item.title: Report E-2025050268
item.description:
Report E-2025050268

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, four (4) 5-gallon pails of resin solution were crushed in transit due to improper loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, cleaning agents, and hand tools to remediate the trailer interior. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums, and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) additional drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050426
item.description:
Report X-2025050426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: KENT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Cameron Reynolds contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Cameron stated they were attempting to unload trailer 660418 when they noticed a strong odor emitting from the trailer. Cameron stated the freight shifted during transit and another pallet struck a pallet containi ng 5-gallon buckets of UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, PG I. Cameron stated one of the 5-gallon buckets on top of the pallet was punctured on the side resulting in a 2-gallon spillage onto the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2025050324
item.description:
Report X-2025050324

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was a return shipment of a lawnmower. It was placed in the shipping box upside down and the gas cap was loose. It leaked gasoline onto and in the shipping box and was noticed as it was being loaded into a trailer during the Outbound Sort. it was brought to the hazmat cage. Using FAST, we tried to locate a phone number for the shipper. The phone number we found for Nematulah was disconnected. We tried to find another phone number. Numerous attempts at possible relatives proved futile. All the phone numbers were disconnected and no longer in service. We contacted Amerisun to see if they had a phone number for Nematulah based on the P.O. number on the barcode. Amerisun said that even though they showed as the original shipper, they had no record of the P.O. and that it was purchased through a third party vendor and they had no information.

item.title: Report E-2025050201
item.description:
Report E-2025050201

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: SeaTac
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A passenger’s personal electronic device (a disposable vape) went into battery thermal runaway. United flight 3393 was waiting in the que for take-off when a passenger sitting in 14 A rang the Flight attendant call button. The Flight attendant reported that visible smoke was spewing from the vape pen intermittently. The device was not designed so that the battery could be removed. The flight attendant took the device which was hot but not so much that it couldn’t be handled. The Flight attendant placed the device in a plastic bucket and submerged it in water. The device continued to expel smoke under water. The duration of release was not specified. The flight attendant informed the pilot in command of the situation and the flight returned to the gate while still on the ground. At the gate the device was removed from the aircraft, placed in a fire containment bag, submerged again under water until the device cooled down. The national response center was notified shortly after the event was reported.

item.title: Report E-2025050306
item.description:
Report E-2025050306

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: RENTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 12:50 EST, ERTS was contacted by Austin McKay of XPO Logistics (USE) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 3 gallons of Hammerhead Epoxy Resin Base - Base Resin Yellow Part A Extended Hardener (hazardous - UN2735) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri was placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
